dict.acceptation: 多数；（获胜的）票数；成年；法定年龄；

sent.orig: He was elected by a large majority [by a majority of 3240].
sent.trans: 他以大多数票[超过对方3240票]当选。

sent.orig: Daschle was former Senate Majority Leader majority leader and a close adviser advisor to the president.
sent.trans: 达施勒是前参议院多数党领袖，也是总统的亲密顾问。

sent.orig: The government does not have an overall majority, ie a majority over all other parties together.
sent.trans: 政府没有获得（超过各党派票数的）总合多数票。

sent.orig: The great majority (majority) of victims are female as many as half are children and teenagers.
sent.trans: 大多受害者是女性，几乎一半是儿童和青少年。

sent.orig: Without restriction the rule of majority is easy to lead to the Tyranny of majority.
sent.trans: 多数人统治如果缺乏制约，极易导致多数人的暴政。
